SSB data

2023-08-10

SSBData.Rmd

Data

For 2008-2021, we technically use DMIS data but we rename the columns to match the names of VTR columns. Like Geret mentioned, some of these variables come from the NEFSC data dictionary (https://nova.nefsc.noaa.gov/datadict/) and some were generated by us.

PORTLANDED was generated by us for the reports. PORTLND1 and STATE1 both come from the vessel logs (). PORTLANDED is a concatenation of STATE1 and PORTLND1 that are variables from VTR. They’re currently in the offshore wind package. You have to press f1 on VTR_FIN while the package is loaded:

Each row represents landings (InsideLANDED) and effort (IsideDAS) by species,gear,port,day for an atlanits box as a proportion of the trips total

PORT Port Identification Number. Combined code for state, port and county. See CFDBS PORT for codes.

YEAR Year vessel sailed

VESID VTR VESSEL table record identifier which is a generated internal key. Renamed from VESSEL_ID

NESPP3 3-digit CFDBS Species code. Species category only; market category not specified.

MONTH Month vessel sailed

AREA Renamed from CAREA. Statistical area calculated from the actual latitudes and longitudes.

GEARCODE VTR Gear code; see VLGEAR table for codes

DAY Day vessel sailed

DAS Days at sea

TRIPID VESLOG Trip record identifier, which is generated internally; Primary key for VESLOGyyyyT; Foreign key to VESLOGyyS, VESLOGyyG. Equivalent to DOCID in VTR DOCUMENT table.

TRIPCATG Type of trip: 1=Commercial; 2=Party; 3=Charter; 4=RSA/EFP. Note: RSA/EFP landings represent a small amount of all commercial landings; landings vary by gear type and species.

SERIAL_NUM Serial number of vessel trip report

PORTLND1 Name of first port landed. Concatenate with State1 for full location definition.

STATE1 First State Landed; Two letter postal abbrv.

GEARNM Gear name

IDNUM Renamed from GEARID. VESLOG Gear record identifier; Primary key for VESLOGyyyyG. Equivalent to IMGID in VTR IMAGES table. Foreign key in VESLOGyyyyS.

LIVE QTYKEPT variable multiplied by SPPCONV variable

QTYKEPT Amount of catch kept (Commercial = pounds; Party/Charter = count)

SPPNM Species Name

LAT Calculated decimal latitude format from CLATDEG, CLATMIN, and CLATSEC variables using the angle2dec function

LON Calculated decimal longitude format from CLATDEG, CLATMIN, and CLATSEC variables using the angle2dec function

REVENUE Generated Revenue

GEARCAT Gear category

FMP Fishery Management Plan

LEN Length, in feet, of the vessel

PORTLANDED concatenation of STATE1 + PORT1

Missing Ports (NA)

“I have some memory of missing ports being an issue awhile back. Looking into it now, it looks like an issue with the VTR data itself. VTR tables and DMIS all have NULL Port information. Re-building our current Wind table won’t fix it.

Now, the potentially good news is that, in CAMS, missing ports are not an issue. The caveat is that there is a hierarchy to the main Port field of Dealer > VTR > Principle port (from permit info). Most of the time, Dealer and VTR port are the same but in some cases they may differ. See the summary below and comparisons of each data source. Results are attached as well”
